title: Remake bug
body: Was in a game just now for 3:32.  Top laner on my team got first blood, but the enemy team was able to remake.  WTF?  I have a screenshot if Riot would like to see....

replies.body:
Hey Kinetika,

I'm one of the developers who worked on /remake.  We updated the rules for /remake based on some player feedback.  A first blood will not prevent a remake from happening unless it happens against the remaking team, before the player leaves.  The primary purpose of this rule is to prevent a player from quitting after the other team scores a kill, and hoping for a remake.  

The original post you cited was unfortunately out of date, but has since been updated.  You can see the detailed changes here: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/play-games-matter/remake

Why would a player quit hoping for a remake? 
The player who leaves still gets the game counted as a loss, don't they?

> [{quoted}](name=Nameless Voice,realm=EUW,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=jE284ytm,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2016-06-18T08:46:44.620+0000)
>
> Why would a player quit hoping for a remake? 
> The player who leaves still gets the game counted as a loss, don't they?

to prevent having someone taking one for the team? I dunno if it happens with randoms

In the case of premade teams, then shouldn't teammates share the loss?
(I think that's currently only at very high MMR, however.)


To be honest, it's kind of an odd case.  In the case where friends are playing together, then it makes sense that it counts as a loss for all of them.  I'm less sure about a case where people who randomly queue up with people (e.g. from a previous game, or from the suggestion box) - in that case, they might not actually know that the player is toxic and it would be a little unfair to punish them.

Would it be possible for you to tell Scarizard next time to include the "updated" parts in the patch notes? 

At least let us know it was updated and go read the article again.

The remake just happened to me after I got first blood, and I was so sad to find out it was intended.

Thank you....appreciate the reply. 

I get why that was changed, but it sucks that we lose so much time (in queue, champ select, game loading etc).  

How about giving everyone in a /remake a free one game skin boost when a remake occurs?   Would not only make me feel better about the time wasted, but who doesn't like a skin boost?   Good way to use a negative situation to spread some goodwill and maybe reduce some toxicity.

Just a thought.

Brings up incentive issues when you're rewarding people for other people doing bad things. Like, you want to get a free skin boost, so you want other people to AFK sometimes, so maybe you and your 4 man premade behave poorly and get people to AFK.

Not saying it's completely bad; getting any kind of insurance has the same incentive issue (where the abuse is called insurance fraud and is illegal). It's more like this is why they won't do it, because maybe people will abuse it.

Yeah I'm sure that would be a potential issue, but a 4 man premade would have to make quick work of things because the AFK has to be gone for 90 seconds prior to the 3 min mark.  That's pretty quick.

Also, skin boosts are temporary and not really worth much IMO.  If someone is willing to waste between 10 and 15 min of their time to get a skin boost in the next game, more power to them....seems like a horrible trade to me.  Better than getting nothing for waiting 10-15 min, but still, it's not something I'd ever intentionally do.

That's definitely a reason to avoid this sort of thing, AsphodelNext.  /remake determines the outcome of a game for 10 people - that's pretty impactful, so we wouldn't want to create incentives for people to use it in a strange way.

I feel your pain, Kinetika, it's a lot of time to waste, but I hope it's better than playing through an unfair game.
Yeah but think about it....the other team can do the opposite if they know you have an AFK - 5 man dive one of the solo lanes/jungle so  you can't remake, and then you're stuck with a 4 v 5.
What does it matter? You shouldn't be so toxic that you feel bummed when you can't rob someone of 20lp. I say if it is a bug, it is a good one and needs to be a thing.

1. We didn't know that there was an AFK.
2. Toxic?  I'm bummed that I waited 10 min to get a game going only to have it cancelled after another 3 min.
3.  Toxic is coming into a thread and telling me how to feel about what appears to be a bug in a game.  Go troll somewhere else...I bet you play Vayne

1. You did know there was an AFK, that's why you made a post asking if it was a bug that they still could remake, even though you got the first blood. The point is is it shouldnt matter if you got first blood or not they had an afk. You just wanted the free win. I know you are mad because you didnt get a free win, but get over it.

I think you misunderstood...we didn't know there was an AFK when the first blood occurred...in other words, we thought the game was going well, and it wasn't until we saw the surrender that we realized there was an AFK

I could get a lvl 1 quadra not knowing they had an afk, and if they ended up getting to remake id still think it was a good thing they got to remake. Regardless of weather I would have won the game even if they had a 5th, its still frustrating for them to have to play at a disadvantage.
Once the /remake vote starts, it will resolve regardless of kills. No bug here.
1st blood at 2:32, which would mean that the vote would have had to start prior to the kill, but the game ended at 3:32.  Sure there's no bug?

Explane me please - why if Remake votes 2 yes and 3 no - it still counts for Remake? Its bug! I had this 3 or 4 times in game already! Its ruins all mood for playing next games. 
Why if player recconected its still makes Remake active?!

@riot stopthief, here is a bug for you. I got demoted from a remake game and my entire team lost lp. even though we werent connected to the person who afked in any way shape or form. here is proof: http://puu.sh/pJbBB/e6609d4507.jpg
First blood will only prevent remake if it happens before the player leaves. If the player leaves before first blood happens, then it will not prevent a remake.

> [{quoted}](name=Zombiemaster,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=jE284ytm,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-06-17T05:24:46.994+0000)
>
> First blood will only prevent remake if it happens before the player leaves. If the player leaves before first blood happens, then it will not prevent a remake.

Yeah well that's not what Riot's notes say:


If any player is dc’d or flagged afk for at least ninety seconds at the three minute mark, and there’s been no first blood, all players on the short-handed team are prompted to /remake with a chat message

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/play-games-matter/remake

Yes, it does say that on that page. However, in the patch notes, it says that the first blood needs to be before the player leaves/disconnects

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-612-notes#patch-remake

> If any player dc’s or is flagged afk for at least 90 seconds at the three minute mark, a /remake is available. Except in cases of the...

> A first blood against a player’s team _**before they leave/dc**_ will prevent a remake vote

Same thing just happened to me in a ranked game during promos. I got first blood at ~1:30, then they /remake at 3:23 and it goes through. The match history link doesn't work, and I didn't get a win for promos because of this bug. The other team was laughing because they knew the bug existed and literally laughed in our faces after the game. I am beyond ticked off...

EDIT: I got first blood at 1:50 exactly. How can this huge a bug slip through and allow users such a huge, unfair advantage? I do not know.
Sorry that happened to you too, but glad to hear I'm not crazy.
my game i just played there top got first blood and i killed him before 2:30 any kills before 3 mins keeps game going can't remake till after 3 i got screenshot if want to see
